verses.kjv: Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;
verses.web: In the same way, wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; so that, even if any don’t obey the Word, they may be won by the behavior of their wives without a word,
verses.ct: In the same way, wives, place yourselves under the authority of your own husbands. That way, even if some of them don't obey the word, they can be won over without a word — simply by watching how their wives live.

verses.kjv: While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear.
verses.web: seeing your pure behavior in fear.
verses.ct: When they see your pure and reverent way of life, it will speak for itself.

verses.kjv: Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;
verses.web: Let your beauty be not just the outward adorning of braiding the hair, and of wearing jewels of gold, or of putting on fine clothing;
verses.ct: Don't let your beauty be about outward things — braided hair, gold jewelry, or fine clothes.

verses.kjv: But let it be the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.
verses.web: but in the hidden person of the heart, in the incorruptible adornment of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is very precious in the sight of God.
verses.ct: Instead, let your beauty come from deep inside — the kind that never fades — a gentle and quiet spirit. That is what God considers truly precious.

verses.kjv: For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:
verses.web: For this is how in the past, the holy women who hoped in God also adorned themselves, being in subjection to their own husbands.
verses.ct: This is exactly how the holy women of the past made themselves beautiful. They put their hope in God and placed themselves under the authority of their husbands.

verses.kjv: Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.
verses.web: So Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord, whose children you now are, if you do well, and are not put in fear by any terror.
verses.ct: Sarah, for example, obeyed Abraham and called him her lord. You are her daughters when you do what is right and refuse to give in to fear.

verses.kjv: Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.
verses.web: You husbands, in the same way, live with your wives according to knowledge, giving honor to the woman, as to the weaker vessel, as also being joint heirs of the grace of life, that your prayers may not be hindered.
verses.ct: Husbands, in the same way, be thoughtful in how you live with your wives. Treat her with honor as the physically weaker partner, and as an equal heir of the gracious gift of life. Do this so that nothing will stand in the way of your prayers.

verses.kjv: Finally, be ye all of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren, be pitiful, be courteous:
verses.web: Finally, all of you be like-minded, compassionate, loving as brothers, tenderhearted, courteous,
verses.ct: Finally, all of you should be united in how you think, full of compassion for each other, loving as brothers and sisters, tenderhearted, and humble.

verses.kjv: Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.
verses.web: not rendering evil for evil, or insult for insult; but instead blessing, knowing that you were called to this, that you may inherit a blessing.
verses.ct: Never pay back evil with evil or an insult with an insult. Instead, respond with a blessing — because that's what God called you to do, so that you would inherit a blessing.

verses.kjv: For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:
verses.web: For, “He who would love life and see good days, let him keep his tongue from evil and his lips from speaking deceit.
verses.ct: For Scripture says: "Whoever wants to love life and see good days must keep their tongue from evil and their lips from speaking lies.

verses.kjv: Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.
verses.web: Let him turn away from evil and do good. Let him seek peace and pursue it.
verses.ct: They must turn away from evil and do good. They must search for peace and chase after it.

verses.kjv: For the eyes of the Lord are over the righteous, and his ears are open unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord is against them that do evil.
verses.web: For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous, and his ears open to their prayer; but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.”
verses.ct: For the Lord watches over those who do right, and his ears are open to their prayers. But the Lord sets his face against those who do evil."

verses.kjv: And who is he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?
verses.web: Now who will harm you if you become imitators of that which is good?
verses.ct: Who is going to harm you if you are passionate about doing good?

verses.kjv: But and if ye suffer for righteousness’ sake, happy are ye: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;
verses.web: But even if you should suffer for righteousness’ sake, you are blessed. “Don’t fear what they fear, neither be troubled.”
verses.ct: But even if you do suffer for doing what is right, you are blessed. Don't be afraid of what they threaten, and don't let it shake you.

verses.kjv: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:
verses.web: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts. Always be ready to give an answer to everyone who asks you a reason concerning the hope that is in you, with humility and fear,
verses.ct: Instead, set apart Christ as Lord in your hearts. Always be ready to explain the hope you carry to anyone who asks — but do it with gentleness and respect,

verses.kjv: Having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.
verses.web: having a good conscience. Thus, while you are spoken against as evildoers, they may be disappointed who curse your good way of life in Christ.
verses.ct: keeping a clear conscience. That way, when people slander you and attack your good conduct in Christ, they will end up ashamed of their own words.

verses.kjv: For it is better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.
verses.web: For it is better, if it is God’s will, that you suffer for doing well than for doing evil.
verses.ct: After all, if God's will leads you to suffer, it's far better to suffer for doing good than for doing evil.

verses.kjv: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:
verses.web: Because Christ also suffered for sins once, the righteous for the unrighteous, that he might bring you to God, being put to death in the flesh, but made alive in the Spirit,
verses.ct: For Christ himself suffered for sins once and for all — the righteous one dying for the unrighteous — so that he could bring us to God. He was put to death in the flesh but made alive by the Spirit.

verses.kjv: By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;
verses.web: in whom he also went and preached to the spirits in prison,
verses.ct: Through the Spirit, he also went and proclaimed his message to the spirits held in prison —

verses.kjv: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.
verses.web: who before were disobedient, when God waited patiently in the days of Noah, while the ship was being built. In it, few, that is, eight souls, were saved through water.
verses.ct: those who had been disobedient long ago, when God waited patiently during the days of Noah while the ark was being built. In that ark, only a few people — 8 souls — were saved through water.

verses.kjv: The like figure whereunto even baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:
verses.web: This is a symbol of baptism, which now saves you—not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
verses.ct: And that water points to baptism, which now saves you — not as a washing of dirt from the body, but as an appeal to God from a clear conscience, made possible through the resurrection of Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.
verses.web: who is at the right hand of God, having gone into heaven, angels and authorities and powers being made subject to him.
verses.ct: He has gone into heaven and sits at the right hand of God, with angels, authorities, and powers all placed under his command.
